li.a: Natrona County Recreation Joint Powers Board
English as a Second Language Program
Assessment and Testing Info For Parents

div.h1: NCSD Updates and Information on Coronavirus

div.h4: NCSD Schools and Buildings Closed – March 16th through April 30th, 2020
div.p: Based on the extended state health orders of Governor Gordon and State Superintendent Jillian Balow, all NCSD schools and buildings will be closed until at least April 30th, 2020.
Virtual Adapted/Remote learning is required and may be in a variety of formats, to support all students, including digital learning, mailed/printed packets, video chats, phone calls, and more.
If you have not heard from your school, please directly call or email your child’s principal.

We wanted to take a moment to say THANK YOU to our students, staff, parents, school families, and community. As we embark upon this journey together, we wanted to share our appreciation for each of you.

We are working diligently to do all we can to continue to support students, staff, and school families as, together, we navigate these unprecedented times. Thank you for all you are doing, and please, if you are needing assistance or additional resources reach out to your school principal or to us at communications@myncsd.org.
We appreciate the patience and support of our students, staff, and school families as we all work together to ensure continued student academic success and health and safety for all.

We will continue working in direct collaboration with the Casper Natrona County Public Health Department, the Wyoming Department of Health, the Natrona County Emergency Management Office, the Wyoming Department of Education, and other local, state, and federal expert agencies to monitor information and updates as related to the Coronavirus.
We appreciate the patience and support of our community as we all work together to keep our schools, families, and community safe.

hr.p: NCSD Food Service will continue to provide a takeaway breakfast and lunch meal, M-F, from 11:30am – 1:00pm, to all individuals 18 years and under. We are asking for individuals to assist us in following the Casper Natrona County Health Department’s social distancing guidelines. Individuals may pick-up meals for their siblings and family members 18 years and younger to help assist in maintaining social distancing.
Additional locations have been established. Individuals 18 years and under can pick-up meals at the following locations:
Signage will be outside to direct individuals where to pick-up the meal.

hr.h4: K-12 Educational Resources for Continued Academic Engagement
hr.p: We are dedicated to sharing educational resources to families during this time to assist in keeping students active and engaged in educational opportunities while keeping their health and safety as the highest priority.
These educational opportunities are not required for grading purposes during the March 16th-April 5th, 2020 closure. These activities are opportunities for review and practice.

We greatly appreciate all parents and guardians for your continued dedication to keeping your child engaged in academic opportunities. Your partnership is critical for continued student success, thank you. We truly are #BetterTogether

The safety of our students, staff, and school families remains our top priority. We appreciate the patience and support of our community as we all work together to keep our schools, families, and community safe.

Though schools and buildings will remain closed starting March 16 – April 5, 2020 vacancies and job openings will continue to be posted. For positions in which you qualify, please submit the online application.
